title: Greece Employment Change
description: Employment in Greece increased by 0.40 in June of 2022. Employment Change in Greece averaged 0.15 percent from 1995 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 3.60 percent in the second quarter of 2021 and a record low of -3.80 percent in the first quarter of 2015. In Greece, employment change refers to the quarterly change in the number of persons who work for pay or profit, or perform unpaid family work. Estimates include both full-time and part-time employment. This page provides - Greece Employment Change- actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: EUROSTAT
